page.title: 03TOURISM IN LITTLEPORT
page.content: There is very little tourism in Littleport, apart from visitors to Washingtons{caravan site}at the New River, Littleport. Most holiday people stay there for the {fishing,}and they stay there at any time of the year. Littleport has three caravan sites _ Kiama, Kings and Washingtons. Residential caravans are often bought by Americans, who work at the local{USAF bases}at Mildenhall and Lakenheath, and they own the caravan as well as the land on which it stands. Washingtons has only recently become a caravan site, although the Washington family have owned the land for a long time.They converted the grass land to a suitable site by building washing facilities and toilets there.
